page.title: 07INTERESTING PEOPLE.
page.content: BILLY BEAUMONT: Captain of England's Rugby Union side which won the Grand Slam, B.B.C commentator and personality on 'Question of Sport' He came into St. Gregory's school to tell us about himself and began by confessing to want to play Football. However he was sent to a Bording School aged 8 and Rugby was the only game to play.He later played for Fylde R.U. Club,playing his first game for England at 22. He played 34 games for his Country and retired on his Doctor's advice with a strained neck. He now works in Park Mill in Chorley, which his grandfather founded in 1914. His career has taken him all over the world and now so does his business. He told us how 'Question of Sport' was made and how he commentates on the Rugby Union International Matches. He also does one or two T.V. adverts,a very talented man
